name: Left Handed
description:
A quirky, coming-of-age story. Click Here for a Preview

Reader Feedback:

“Most outstanding to me as a reader was the novella's graceful and unaffected voice, which deftly captured the pains and mysteries of adolescence. The prose-style is vivid and sensitive.” Christopher Rice, Author, Los Angeles, CA

“Not since I read The Perks of Being a Wallflower have I read a story about teenagers that allowed me to engage deeply and emotionally with the characters without censor, leaving me with a beautiful melancholy longing for more.” -Kate Doherty, Youth Minister, Oakland, CA

“How are you sending me on this nostalgic trip!?!” -Greta Genace, Teacher, Jersey City, NJ

“Excellent book! It took me away to this cool hip world that reminded me of The Outsiders.” Allen Foster, Musician, Philadelphia, PA

“It’s very addictive. It kind of reminds me of a more current My So-Called Life.” -Lindsay Kovnat, Animator, Philadelphia, PA
